caseTitle: Tariq Mehmood v. Naseer Ahmed and another
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Asif Saeed Khan Khosa
tagline: In all cases covered by the provisions of subsection (2) of section 345, Cr.P.C. no compromise entered into by the parties privately can have any legal sanctity or validity vis-à-vis compounding of the relevant offence unless the court before which the prosecution for the relevant offence is pending grants a formal permission accepting the compromise between the parties and in all such cases if no prosecution is pending before any court when the compromise is entered into and no permission by the trial court is granted to compound the offence any compromise privately entered into between the parties cannot be accepted as valid compounding as is declared by subsection (7) of section 345, Cr.P.C.
